page.title: 19Mr. an d Mrs. L. Steed
page.content: Les Steed,whose father was a railway signalman,moved to Braybrooke when he was two and went to the village school staying there until he was 14.Mrs. Foster the head taught all subjects to all ages and Les enjoyed school and liked Mrs.Foster.He passed the scholar- ship to go to Grammar school but was not able to go.At 14 he started work as a signal box boy.After service in the army he returned to the railway in 1946 Mavis his wife worked as the school cook from 1966 until 1983.They have seen the village change.Materially things are better but people are less contented and less willing to help each other.Much new building has taken place When they first lived here everybody knew everybody and spoke but now they have changed and the people are less friendly.
